description: Engine Misfire Detected on Startup (First 1000 Revolutions)
info: This diagnostic trouble code (DTC) is a generic powertrain code, which means that it applies to OBD-II equipped vehicles. Although generic, the specific repair steps may vary depending on make/model.
This P0316 code means the powertrain control module (PCM) has detected a misfire shortly after startup, specifically within the first 1,000 revolutions.

This code may also be triggered with another of the other misfire codes which are P0300, P0301, P0302, P0303, P0304, P0305, P0306, P0307, P0308, P0309, P0310, P0311, P0312. If you have another misfire trouble code also, you should diagnose and repair that code(s) first.
symptoms:
MIL (Malfunction indicator lamp) illumination
Rough engine start or idle
causes: Potential causes of this misfire code may include:

Damaged or defective Crankshaft Position Sensor (CKP)
CKP sensor wiring or connector fault
Poor fuel quality
Ran out of fuel
Ignition system malfunction
Fuel system malfunction: injector or fuel pump
Mechanical engine problem
Damaged PCM
